author: Jessica Walker
title: Strawberry-Pretzel Salad
ingredients: 2 packages (4-serving size each) Jell-O® strawberry-flavored gelatin
2 boxes (16 oz each) frozen sweetened strawberries, thawed
1 container (8 oz) Cool Whip frozen whipped topping, thawed
2 packages (4-serving size each) Jell-O® strawberry-flavored gelatin
2 boxes (16 oz each) frozen sweetened strawberries, thawed
1 container (8 oz) Cool Whip frozen whipped topping, thawed

instructions_list: Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Stir in strawberries; refrigerate until partially set, about 1 hour 45 minutes.
Heat oven to 350° F. In medium bowl, mix Crust ingredients. Press into ungreased 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Bake 10 minutes. Cool on cooling rack.
In medium bowl, beat Filling ingredients with electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. Spread over cooled crust. Cover and refrigerate until cool and gelatin topping in bowl is partially set.
Carefully spoon gelatin topping over filling. Refrigerate 4 to 6 hours or until firm. To serve, cut into 4 rows by 3 rows.
description: This phenomenal berry dish is a great option if you need a sweet treat and your oven is already full of tasty dishes. The irresistible blend of creamy, crunchy, sweet and salty makes it a hit for any season and occasion. With a little prep and refrigeration time, you'll be enjoying your Strawberry Pretzel Salad as the perfect after-meal dessert.
